intro: Mischogyne iddii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, alternate leaves that are usually ovate or elliptical in shape. Its fruit is a round, fleshy berry that contains several seeds. Mischogyne iddii is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
